definition: dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
to substitute/to act on behalf of others/to replace/generation/dynasty/age/period/(historical) era/(geological) eon

sentences.english: This stone axe is a relic of the Old Stone Age.
sentences.chinese: 這把石斧是舊石器時代的遺物。

sentences.english: The Peking man during that time belongs to the Paleolithic Period.
sentences.chinese: 北京人在當時屬於舊石器時代。

sentences.english: The microlithic tool tradition appeared in the late paleolithic period.
sentences.chinese: 到舊石器時代晚期，同時存在細石器技術傳統的產品。

sentences.english: Our palaeolithic ancestors consumed around 100 g of fibre per day.
sentences.chinese: 我們舊石器時代的祖先每天喫約100克纖維。

sentences.english: People have been eating mushrooms since Palaeolithic times.
sentences.chinese: 人們已喫蘑菇自舊石器時代倍。

sentences.english: The stone balls were tools of hunting in Paleolithic times.
sentences.chinese: 石球是舊石器時代原始人用來狩獵的工具。

sentences.english: Similar stone circles are found throughout the upper and lower paleolithic.
sentences.chinese: 類似的石圈在舊石器時代早期和晚期都曾發現。

sentences.english: Peking Man lived 690000 years ago, during Paleolithic times.
sentences.chinese: 北京猿人生活在六十九萬年前的舊石器時代。

definition: the Bronze Age/also written 青銅時代|青铜时代[Qing1 tong2 Shi2 dai4]
Guanzhong plain in Shaanxi, valley of the Wei River 渭河
slave-owning society (precedes feudal society 封建社會|封建社会 in Marxist theory)
offspring a famous family (idiom); good breeding/blue blood
